content.description: Good warm up / introductory climb. many options for hands and feet.
content.location: to the left of the overhanging with boulders underneath, the side which usually is facing the sun.

content.description: The crux which involves very tiny edges for feet and small pockets is near the top at and right below the ledge. Topout is easy. Big reachy move over the ledge, to get it either really press down on those tiny feet or get a heel hook at around chest height.
content.protection: at least one well placed pad.
content.location: Furthest route to the right of the trail leading to the Big Boi Boulder. Begin on 2 decently sized pockets and watch as they become smaller and smaller the higher you get, fun!

content.description: Big long, strong moves the entire way up to a messy left-leaning topout.
content.location: Sun lit side of the rock, left and around the corner from the entrance trail. begin on a big flat ridge and move straight up from there. Topout is chossy and terrible so move left.

content.description: Climb the arete to the right of chalk bag and pp. Start on two sharp pinches and make your way up.
This route has an opportunity for some crazy foot work but lacks flow and movement is jagged / sporadic between holds for the most part.
content.location: Left side of the main boulder, opposite side of entrance trail

content.description: Line found by Shane Vosberg. Start to the left of "The Butter Churner," but still right of the arete. Two good start holds that are fairly obvious. Big move to a decent left pocket followed by a bigger move to a great (but sharp) pocket above. Finish on the right side of the arete for a V2+ crux, or finish on the left side of the arete for an easier V2 topout.
Great climb especially when climbing with little or no protection. Good for endurance.  Lots of good side-pulls and 2-3 finger pockets: your fingers will understand the name of the route.
content.location: Seated Start on the slight overhang to the right of Pocket Pussy.  Traverse left up the slope until you reach the end of the side of the boulder.

climbs.name: Does The Size of My Chalk Bag Matter?

content.description: Very enjoyable on the latter half of the climb. Beginning has some small holds. Top is very committing but easier than the bottom.
content.location: Directly up the middle of the tallest side of the main boulder. start below the big sidepull

content.description: A very easy route for beginners / warm up that ascends the down climbing area of the Big Boi Boulder.
content.location: Around the corner and to the left of the side of the main boulder facing the entrance trail. It is located on the down-climb of the boulder.

content.description: traverse left to right on tricky moves to hard overhanging moves around corner then top out
content.location: on the east side of boulder 2

content.description: Very smooth up until the top where you need a real high foot. Flows very nicely.
content.protection: Well placed pad(s) especially over those death boulders below
content.location: Left and around the corner if you are facing the rock from the entrance trail. Part of a steep overhang. Watch the rocks underneath you in the fall zone...

content.description: This is THE route to show your friends who have never climbed anything. Make sure to yell lots of words of encouragement and beta at them. Follow the crack up to the topout for the best holds.
content.location: To the left of the entrance trail, its right in your face when you approach the main boulder.
